Reviews.Title: worse digital camera I have owned
Reviews.Author: Shaz Davison
Reviews.Content: I had my Panasonic digital camera stolen in Cusco Peru on Christmas eve so I went to a store and bought the best camera (specs wise) available so I'd have one for Christmas and this camera was it.Its display screen is far too dark to see what to focus on (no way to change it) and the many times the auto focus simply does not work - focusing on NOTHING. I MUCH prefer my old Lumix as it took excellent photos (though it shutter button and protective lens has a tendency to be temperamental over time.)As a part time photographer, I would never recommend this camera to even a novice.  While the size is great, spec look great on paper and is quite portable, all that goes out the window if it only half your photos will be in focus.Pass on this one!

Reviews.Title: I LOVE this camera !!
Reviews.Author: Timothy Bennett "Electronics dreamer t.j."
Reviews.Content: I just got my Fuji Finepix JX250 today,and i absoulutely love it so far! Its very portable,fits great in my pocket,it looks really nice,although i did think it would look more metalic based on the pics online.I upgraded from a z30 to this one and im glad i did! The z30 was only 10 MP and i thought the pics came out great,buti can definately tell the difference in the MP. The JX250 takes great pics! They are colorful,and really crisp and clear looking! The cameras zoom is great also,you can zoom in the full 5Xs and the pic doesnt look any different! One thing that i noticed is that the HD video option only allows a 59 second movie,idk if there is a way to change this yet,or maybe its something to do with my SD card since its only a 256MB,which i am hoping to upgrade to a 2G really soon! But so far this camera is all i hoped it would be.If ur someone that needs a somewhat bulky camera to feel its durable,then u might not want this camera because its only almost 2 inches wide,and only almost 6 inches long,but if u really want a camera that takes really good pics,and fits easily in ur pocket or purse then i would recommend this camera. Its very eay to use as well!

Reviews.Title: 14 Mega Pixel Capture Unfortunatley only a 2 Mega Pixel quality lens
Reviews.Author: Troxel
Reviews.Content: Wow, I am underwhelmed with this camera and the poor optical quality of the lens.Yes it will capture a 14 mega pixel image (and create *huge* image files to fill up the memory card - which is NOT included), but the resolution of the lens delivers an image with the quality of a 2 megapixel camera.The lens is not sharp at any focal length. Enlargements? don't even think about bigger than an 8X10 - especially if you will also be cropping the image.I have 4 digital cameras, all point and shoots.  Of the 4, this camera produces the poorest quality pictures - yet it has the highest megapixel rating.I would not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this piece of crap camera
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera before we left for a vacation based on the price for the 14 megapixels. Within two days of receiving it, the shutter of the camera would not close, making the camera unusable. We sent it back to Fuji Canada, and they provided an estimate for the repairs saying we had damaged the camera, even though we had taken a total of 10 pictures. After two months, we do not have a camera and have lost around $180 + shipping. There are a ton of entry-level cameras right around this price range, and I recommend people considering a point and shoot camera should look at a Canon Powershot or a Panasonic Lumix (both of which we have been really pleased with in the past). This camera has a lot less features than those other models, and based on our experience, I hope I can talk at least one person out of buying this camera. I will never buy Fuji again.Fujifilm FinePix JX250 14 MP Digital Camera with 5x Wide Angle Optical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: David van Popering
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera just before my trip to Disney and I can tell you it has met all my expectations. Fits in my pocket, light, takes photos quickly, lots of options but sorted out into easy to use way (most times Auto is all you need). I took night photos (firework show), dimly lit rooms, daylight, clouds, rain, etc.  All came out beautiful. What more can I say, fast, easy, light, many options there if you choose to use them...a great camera. I knew someone who bought a camera just before I got this one, and after using theirs returned it and got this one. They too have been happy ever since. Great camera.

Reviews.Title: good but there is better
Reviews.Author: M. Sabra "hotshot"
Reviews.Content: bought this,, 30 days later it wont turn on and if it did the zoom gets stuck, exchanged it for another one , this one is holding up. pretty good not bad, the freaking audio is just amazing stereo sound, picture is good too. but the one thing i about this camera is, it does not charge via USB like the samsung LT110 that i have, you got to take the battery out to charge it but the samsung it charges while you have it connected to your computer no need to take the battery out. other than that the jx250 is good i do recommend it just dont bet on it lasting a life time.

Reviews.Title: Um, awesome camera.
Reviews.Author: Panoramic Glory
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this camera. I've had it for several weeks and have taken tons of pictures and uploaded them and everything. It works wonderfully for me, and I LOVE the panoramic shot option. It is fantastic. It's been all over the place and is durable and beautiful and functional and I'd recommend it to anyone who wants a camera for everyday or vacation or especially casual but still gorgeous landscape photography. All of my photos turned out spectacularly. Love.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Vacation Shots
Reviews.Author: Num47 "Ray A"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a month now and it is perfect for me! Used to have a Nikon until it broke and I had to get a new one. I decided to get this at Costco and man am I pleased!To start off, the weight of this camera is awesome. It is super light and very comfortable to carry around, especially with the leather carrying case with belt hook included! The size of it fits comfortably in my hand also, as it seems to curve at just the right points to hold it steady. Keep in mind that it is plastic, but its durable enough to take a fall, i know lol. The screen on it is also impressive, measuring about 3" diagonally, and is very clear and crisp.The modes on it are a tad confusing but easy to get used to, especially if you use the auto mode, which does everything for you. The responsiveness of the camera is also a plus because within a second it is up and ready to shoot, perfect for those spontaneous pictures. The battery is included with the piece is a 3.7 volt rechargeable battery that will last for an easy week with daily use, or for a good amount of months if not. With it also it comes with a 4gb sd memory card so you can start shooting right away. The video I use now and then. I have to admit, for a 720p hd video for such a small camera, that's awesome. Everytime that I use it, I am extremely pleased with the playback quality and the picture and sound is very crisp(and there isn't any internal noise in the camera either)!Overall, a great deal for a camera if you want something simple and functional!I'll try to post some pictures of it and what it can do soon!

Reviews.Title: Good camera, but...
Reviews.Author: Lucile Cheng "cat slave"
Reviews.Content: I have had mine for over a year.  It takes great pix, and simply amazing videos!  I subtracted two stars because it drains batteries so quickly.  I cannot leave home without having first charged the battery in use, PLUS an extra fully charged battery.  Not such a terrible inconvenience, but some great shots come up, and you have to switch batteries, losing your opportunity.  If this can be fixed, this would be a great little camera.

Reviews.Title: Totally Useless
Reviews.Author: L. Dennis Eccleston "Dennis"
Reviews.Content: I have had Fuji cameras in the past and liked the results, especially the F31. This one is worthless as it is too noisy in low light and the LCD is totally unviewable in sunlight even at max brightness. I gave it away but the recipient found the same problem. We need the optical finder back on point and shoot cameras.

Reviews.Title: kills batteries!
Reviews.Author: J. Swanson
Reviews.Content: This camera is junk, you can't even leave the battery in overnight or it will be dead. You might be able to get 1/2 a day of taking pictures before the battery is drained. I thought it was the battery, bought another one, it is not the battery! The camera just sucks all the power out of batteries real fast. Don't buy!

Reviews.Title: Not very good
Reviews.Author: LisaLoo
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for less than 6 months.  It is small, and very easy to use.  However, about two months ago I noticed that some of the images look very pale.  Now, it happens all the time.  When the flash does work (which is not very often), the pictures look like I've taken a picture of a ghost.  It's horrible, totally un-useable for me now.  Don't buy this, it's junk.

Reviews.Title: Eats batteries
Reviews.Author: Happypaws4
Reviews.Content: I am so disappointed in this camera and would never touch Fuji again. Regardless of the use the battery will die in less than 3 days. With a new battery I get at the most 20 pictures. I am going back to Kodak, it may be more expensive but at least you get a good camera.

Reviews.Title: Glad I found this
Reviews.Author: Deborah SCHWEIGERT
Reviews.Content: Lost my 1st camera and then was so happy to find the exact same one, then as luck would have it my 1st camera was found, now I have both and am thrilled!

Reviews.Title: Great for me
Reviews.Author: spas1973
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about buying this product given the mixed reviews...but after buying this product I must say that the people that didn't love this phoneare probably avid professionals... sure it isn't perfect but as a non-professional I found thatI got a lot more that I expected for the price...THIS IS A GREAT DEAL.....granted i have only had it for about a weekbut I'm happy

Reviews.Title: What add-ons?
Reviews.Author: Maurice S. Murphy
Reviews.Content: Nice camera the Fujifilm FinePix JX250 14 MP Digital Camera © with 5x Wide Angle Optical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD for [only] $119 (USD) ships from The Factory Depot. But that is all you get!  If you want to properly use it you WILL need the following items/or variants of the cards, several batteries, in home, in car, even Euro chargers, but not them all together in one purchase and they omit the most vital item, the USB camera > computer cable is a must-have gizmo!Here goes:1. "FUJI BC-45 Equivalent External AC DC Mini Charger for NP-45 Battery used with FinePix / FujiFilm J10 / J20 / J250* / Z10fd / Z20fd / Z30 / Z33 / J26 / J27 / J30 / J35 / Z31 / Z35 / Z37 & Other FinePix Digital Cameras. Includes USB Port and Cable for Charging USB Enabled Cell Phones ** Cable NOT for PC / Photo transfer"  If I wanted a catch-all 12V charger I would have bought one in Radio-Shack, but this seems to be a vital add-on, even if U fry your computer when U plug it in :-($16.99 (Sold by: Accessory Genie).2. 1 "Fujifilm NP-45 Lithium Ion Rechargeable Battery for Fuji Z & J Series Digital Cameras" $10.75 (Sold by: Argent Electronics).3. You can go with the add-on memory (an older version) Amazon suggests for this model: a Fujifilm 4 GB Class 6 SDHC Flash Memory Card © for $11.71, or if you want to fill it up with twice the JPG's or AVI HD videos you can get a "Fujifilm 8 GB Secure Digital High Capacity (SDHC) Class 6 Flash Memory Card". (Sold by: Amazon.com, LLC for $23.42) I checked the Fuji homepage URL and that card will hold the extra GB's of memory with no problem, a card-reader would be nice, but all you will find a 2.0 USB cable with an atypical plug-in (firewire style?) to transfer your work, no mention of a software interface prog that most new digital cameras have to pull the raw material off the camera into the computer for storage/tweaking/uploading/sharing. I'll figure something out or this Edsel goes back!4. And I may need 240-volts DC in the EU or 120-Volts AC back home and have a juiced-up cell phone to tell all my M8's all about the great pictures I took!  No case/carrier; (that's extra$ as are lens cleaning gizmos, and better than multi manufacturer warranties that run from 'as-is' to 3 years) I think I have all my bases covered, but Amazon.com if you are going to sell a camera, at least have the common-sense to list the bare-bones vital augments that make it work... ya think? Slight oversights that Amazon.com may wish to include into a bundled deal for folks who don't want to have to place a rush 2nd order when their dream camera shows up to get it working, then get their bit by bit shipments C/O several vendors showing up over a 5 [working day] period of staying home to sign for the very small packages that arrive in dribs & drabs from 9am to 7pm by FedEx or UPS.  What started off as a very nice specs 'point and shoot' digital camera for a grand total: $126.48 (S/H & base price) add the extra$ to make it work for around $150 USD, and I hope it does all it claims to do.  Couldn't find a date-stamp or timer function for self mug-shots/group photos U may want 2 B in, & no tripod over a few inches high in extraneous add-on multi-colored case & add-on deals.  2 ratings to date, and the 3 thumbnails of the camera only show the front, I would love to see the buttons, dials & sliders on the back of that 2.7" LCD screen. When I get mine and if it works, I will upload close-ups of the (back) part of the camera most who buy a camera want to see 1st in the thumbs.

ProductInfo.Features:
14-megapixel resolution for large, photo-quality prints
Capture 720p HD movies with sound
Fujinon 5x wide-angle (28mm-140mm) optical zoom lens
Tracking Auto Focus
Smile and Blink Detection; Face Detection and Automatic Red-eye Removal
ProductInfo.Name: Fujifilm FinePix JX250 14 MP Digital Camera with 5x Wide Angle Optical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD
